popularityCurve.label: his only bad race this year was the florida derby

clusterList.phrase: his only bad race this year was the florida derby
with what happened in his last start it's kind of hard for me to be as confident as i was for the derby and his other races
he is happy as he can be to be put in a situation to compete for a championship he's ecstatic
what you clearly saw in melbourne is michael was the best in the world from the time his feet hit the wall until he takes his first stroke

when he hit top gear at the two-furlong marker he picked up the leader in a matter of strides he is better than any stayer i've ridden in that he just has that bit of class he equalled sagaro's record of three gold cup wins at ascot and i know there's lots of people who come to the races just to see him
i always felt he would be at his best on turf his last two races were very impressive
subaru most outstanding athlete of the games
it's 10 years since i've had a runner in this race so i'm thrilled i was always hopeful and always confident he'd run a big race especially when the ground turned soft

after the pierse hurdle we always had this race in mind we thought the race would suit him well providing the ground was not too quick we gave him a couple of races on the flat and the blinkers kept him going
this is unbelievable and i got a lovely run through the race he was very tough all the way to the line

he's run a cracker the race didn't pan out as we'd hoped as he got there a bit too soon it could have been worse we could have finished second-last there's a big race in him but we just came across one too good on the day

when i look back at the british open that he came in third it's hard to believe in a good way that he still has that talent and that fire in him now whether it's going to be consistently there is another question

if he runs poorly this race they're going to throw everything at him he's off steroids he has been running against weak horses anything you can imagine will be thrown in his direction and it's unfortunate
i'll put it this way if he didn't run that way in the belmont stakes i'd come into this race saying he's going to run the best race of his life
that's how good he trained up until that race
he is a brilliant young racing driver
his pass of robert kubica at hockenheim at the german grand prix reminded anybody who needed reminding that he has all the speed and skill to be battling at the front
it's neat racing against a guy like steve david because i grew up watching him and cheering for him
it's kind of hard for me to feel as confident as i was for the derby and his other races
he has the highest dedication to running of anybody i've ever seen
apart from his ability on the park i think his experience off it was the thing that attracted me and i'm just very happy that he's agreed with terms and will play for the roar for the next two years
